body.p: “Saw carrion fl: berries just begun to turn – say in a day or 2- Pan. Cornel berries XXX on College Road. Many trees in Barrets orchard on Annursnack –touch the ground all around like a dish cover -& weighed down with fruit –and the branches are no thicker over head than around- Is not this the best form for an apple tree- a hollow hemisphere –nearly resting on the earth-the branches equally dispersed over the superficies-& light and air equally admitted.”
"XVII / 13 February-3 September 1854 / NNPM MA 1302:23 / PE 8, p.269 vol.8; Torrey JVI & JVII, p.#"
